answers.answer: If the ray has gone away today. No problem. Problems lingerJCH MD
That's a flag for abnormal blood glucose and diabetes. It is common for the symptoms to come and go. You need an hbcA1C test.
Your symptoms do not at all suggest diabetes, especially since when you stuck your head out the window they went away.  Your symptoms do not require an A1c.JCHMD

question: I noticed last night when I was driving long rays coming street lights and from back of car lights. Could it be windshield was dirty that was causing this? I noticed when I stick my head out the window I did not notice the rays any more My vision is -1.50 in both eyes.
title: long ray of light at night
